(3) Outside the theater at night, two characters stand under the MOVIES sign with skull and couple posters visible. (4) The pair blush while watching a seaside embrace on the big screen. (5) A second female voice cautions that a classic romantic comedy may not be the way to go this time. (6) The narrator explains the 1973 rickety-bridge study that led to more call-backs. (1) The narrator pivots from the propinquity topic to "misattribution of emotions," asking about first movie dates: comedy vs horror.

Therefore, the answer is A: 2 -> 5 -> 3 -> 4 -> 6 -> 1.

The correct chronological order is: 5 -> 4 -> 2 -> 6 -> 1 -> 7 -> 3
Firstly, we have the cloud labeled "Nervousness" appearing as two characters bike nervously by the sea (5). Then, the right-ear segment ends with the word "nervousness" spoken (4). Next, the speaker asks whether nervousness around someone you like could be a good thing (2). After that, the speaker explains that nervous reactions can signal romantic interest and trigger reciprocity (6). This is followed by a friendly sign-off to like, share, subscribe, and turn on notifications (7). Finally, the correct order ends with the speaker suggesting asking someone out to see "It Chapter 2" or "Spider-Man" and giving a tip to speak into their right ear (1).
